content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Original easy puzzle having enough tests.

Got some failures, but maybe because of some missing details :
- when someone uses his special attack, his rage restarts at 0, but does his rage increase at the same turn because hitting ? (at the end of the turn, is the rage 0 or 1 ? I guessed 0)
- About JUN's life : if it's more than the initial life (60), is it minored to 60 ?

Failing test 6, test 8 and validator 8 at the moment.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good puzzle, simple and well explained, the  uncertainties I had for some points were quickly resolved with the tests.
I'm waiting for the level 2 and see if my champions will still be usable.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: looks good to me

Goal
* Paragraph 1: Please change "other" to "of them".

* Paragraph 1: Please change "tell me" to "output".

* Rule 2: Please change to:
When a champion is hit, his/her rage increases by one.

* Rule 3: Please change to:
When a champion uses special attack, his/her rage restarts at {{0}}.

* Rules: Please delete the 4th and 5th rules (which will be covered by the sentence to be added (see second next point) instead).

* Please add (as a new paragraph, not part of the rules):
In the input, each hit is preceded by the direction of the attack:
- {{>}} means [[champion1]] hits [[champion2]].
- {{<}} means [[champion2]] hits [[champion1]].

* Above the table: Please add "The table below shows the starting life and the damage caused by punch, kick and special attack of the champions."

* Table: Please change "Spec.Attack" to "Special Attack".

* Table: Please change "hits given" to "number of hits made".

* Please change "Explanation in details" to "<<Example>>" (bold).

* Example:

  • Please change "perform" to "performed".

  • Please fix the typo: "punchs" => "punches".

  • Please change "ken's" to "Ken's" (twice).

  • The last "punch" line comment is wrong. Please fix it.

  • Please delete the OUTPUT column, and instead show "OUTPUT: Ryu beats Ken in 3 hits" at the bottom (because currently the last line is very long and may not be shown in full on some screen settings).

Inputs
* Please add "<<Line 1>>:" and "<<Line 2>>:".

* Line 1:

  • Please add "separated by a space".

  • change "Champion2" to "champion2".

  • change "Champion" to "champion".

  • delete "them".

  • 6 names are listed here but 7 names are shown in the table. Please be consistent and show the names in the same order.

* Line 2:

  • Please add "An integer".

  • Please change "both" to "the".

* Next n Lines:

  • Please add ":" after "Lines".

Output
* Please change "after" to "in" and "strikes" to "hits" to be consistent with the cases.

* Please format "beats", "after" and "hits" as {{constants}}.

* Please use a different variable name than "N" to avoid confusing it with "n" in Input section.

Constraints
* Please change the first constraint as:
[[champion1]] is always different from [[champion2]].

Cases
* Please delete trailing spaces in the first line of input:
  • Validator 8
  • Test 9
  • Validator 9
  • Test 10
  • Validator 10

Stub generator
* Line 1: Please use the same variable names as in Input section by using read variable_name:word(length)  variable_name:word(length) (i.e. read champion1:word(4) champion2:word(4)).

* Line 3: Same comment.

Thanks.

ok done,
Thank you very for the review :)
Great feedback, level 2 is coming very soon...

- when someone uses his special attack, his rage restarts at 0, but does his rage increase at the same turn because hitting ? (at the end of the turn, is the rage 0 or 1 ? I guessed 0)
=> at the end of the turn: rage=0 YES
- About JUN's life : if it's more than the initial life (60), is it minored to 60 ?
=> JUN's life is not minored to 60.
In my mind, it should work like that... I hope it is what you expect also...
It's what I expected, now I have to see why I fail.

The fight stops when we reach the last line read or when one fighter is dead (life <= 0)

=> maybe "KO" instead of "dead" ?

The fight ends when:
- one champion is KO
- we reach the end of the sequence , then the one with more life wins.

Looks much nicer now. A few more tidy-ups:

Goal
* Paragraph 1: Please change "each them" to "each of them".

Inputs
* Line 1: Please change "[[champion]]" to "each champion" (also remove the variable format).

* Line 2: Please change "maximum" to "total".

* Next n Lines: Please add "separated by a space" before "where".

Thanks.
